lines.text: It's, uh...
Hey, what’s this?
It’s a bathtub. What, you’ve never seen a bathtub before?
I mean, I thought it might be, but…
It’s covered with with a curtain.
I’ll just look underneath, and…
H-hey! Watch it! You can't do that!
Huh?
She’s right. No disturbing the evidence! Hands off, remember?
No disturbing- what if there’s some important clue under there, though?
Then, uh… then you’ll just have to leave it alone, don’t you think?
Wh- are you serious?! I can’t just move a curtain aside?
Look, kid. I’m doin’ things by the book today, got it? Nobody’s ever gonna find a reason to get me written up.
...Well, we’ll see about that.
Now, if you can establish <c=#ff00ff>probable cause</c> to look inside- proof this bathtub is concealin’ important evidence- then that’s another story.
So… I gotta prove there’s something important under there, BEFORE I check whether there’s something important under there?
That’s the long and short of it. You’re a smart kid- get looking!
It’s a bathtub, covered up by a curtain.
Because of some stupid police procedure rules, I can’t check what’s inside until I have some <c=#ff00ff>probable cause.</c>
For now, that means working with Leo and <c=#ff00ff>updating the hypothesis.</c>
